diff_hunk:
@@ -1297,6 +1297,53 @@ def foo(a, b):
         g2result2 = torch.autograd.grad(l3, [da2, db2])
         self.assertEqual(g2result, g2result2)
 
+    def test_script_add(self):
+        cu = torch.jit.jit_script('''
+        def add(a, b) -> (c):
+            c = a + b
+        ''')
+        self.assertExpected(str(cu.get_graph('add')))
body: Since we're actually getting JIT graphs, could we just evaluate them instead of having an expect for every combination of ops we have? That would be a lot simpler and less bug prone
